executive_summary: Accounting service providers have enjoyed steady growth over the past five years, buoyed by economic growth early on in the period and demand for monetary advice through the financial turmoil of the early 2020s. As revenue has expanded, new accounting service providers have begun operating, increasing competition, especially between smaller companies. The most prominent accounting service providers acquired several smaller companies to boost market share during the high growth early in the period. Accounting services revenue has grown at a CAGR of 1.0% to $146.2 billion over the past five years despite an expected decline of 0.9% in 2024 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Account Service Providers Have Faced Volatility
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Accounting services are sensitive to macroeconomic swings. Growth in the number of US businesses drives the performance of account service providers, particularly for small and mid-sized companies, because it increases the number of companies that require accounting services.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: NEW INCOME SOURCES ARE SUSTAINING GROWTH
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Larger accounting service providers have benefited from offering more services in recent years.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: THE LANDSCAPE OF ACCOUNTING SERVICE PROVIDERS HAS CHANGED
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The pandemic reduced merger and acquisition activity in recent years.
